meanings.definition: To dry or partially dry in advance.
meanings.sent1: I need to predry the clothes before putting them in the dryer.
meanings.sent2: It is important to predry the dishes before putting them in the dishwasher.
meanings.sent3: The chef decided to predry the herbs to enhance their flavor in the dish.
meanings.sent4: She likes to predry her hair a bit before using the hairdryer.
meanings.sent5: Remember to predry the paintbrushes before starting the art project.

meanings.sent1: The predry towels were neatly folded on the shelf.
meanings.sent2: The predry wood was ready to be used for the construction project.
meanings.sent3: The predry laundry smelled fresh and clean.
meanings.sent4: The predry soil made it easier to plant the flowers.
meanings.sent5: The predry pasta cooked faster than the fresh one.
